column1: NGR is the north sdie of Astle Hall, the most likely location. The stated altitude is slightly high. Relationship to the church may suggest the gauge is 200m or so further East, but further from the hall

There are duplicated readings between the two gauges, the 1880s have 15 out of 108, including a sequence of 4 readings at the beginning of 1884, and these look suspect. In subsequent decadess the duplications are random and much less sugesting that they are coincidental particularly as the readings for each gauge are generally very close.
